Hi Rich, I really find fees on top of fees vexing. The $10000 sword 
was an=
 example only. For me to get something from Japan, I already 
have 6 or 7% =
duty plus 7% GST now if I went through a middleman 
another 8% plus. This w=
ould seem innocuous on small purchases but it 
adds up. If I could get 8% o=
n purchases dealing in millions per year 
(potentially) and on top of that =
internal shipping is paid and 
external shipping is added plus the handling=
 fee of $10 to pay my 
staff, the 8% is gravy and I would be rich for doing=
 nothing. The 
15% you say some charge is just usurious. Maybe I'm cheap bu=
t that 
is a good gaff. John                                               =
 -
-- In nihontostudy@yahoogroups.com, Richard Turner <ikkanshi@...> 
wrote=
:
>
> Hi John, actually, 8% is not bad, I know of dealers and buyers in 
Ja=
pan 
> who charge 15% and get good custom. The 1000JY fee is for internal 
=
> shipping with in Japan. The issue is, many sellers in Japan won't 
ship 
=
> internationally. They don't want the bother, and they don't pack 
items 
=
> to ship out of the country. The intermediate buyer should handle 
all 
> =
that very well. Mine does.
> 
> Of course everything is a risk and dropping=
 10K on a sword in an 
online 
> auction is pretty risky anyway unless you =
really know what you are 
> doing. There's a lot to be said for holding som=
ething in the hand.
> 
> Rich
> 
> excelsiorilluminati wrote:
> >  Hello Ni=
chido, 8% on top of all the other fees does not seem 
cheap 
> > to me. If =
I was to buy a $10000 sword you get $800 dollars just 
to 
> > redirect it =
to me from a seller who could send it direct. Plus  
1000 
> > yen to have =
it delivered to you and the 1000 yen for who knows 
what. 
> > What would b=
e the benefit? To us that is. 
John                      -
